content: i recommend going down at least 1 needle size or the edge will fan out i really do recommend learning the tubular bind-off though as the finish is so beautiful and it really isn t too difficult once you ve got your head around it this tutorial is helpful https //www youtube com/watch v=fnbanlvzbxw stitches stockinette stitch worked in the round round 1 knit all stitches 1x1 rib worked in the round round 1 *knit 1 purl 1* abbreviations bor beginning of round cc contrast colour k2tog knit 2 together mc main colour m1l make 1 left rs right side ssk slip slip knit tbl through the back loop ws wrong side wyib with yarn in front wyif with yarn in back yo yarn over *…* repeat all instructions from * to * until otherwise stated 8 collar using 4 5 mm us 7 circular needles any length is fine and the long-tail method cast on 76 80 84 88 92 96 100 104 108 112 114 116 stitches change to 3 5 mm us 4 circular needles with a 40-cm 16-in cord join to work in the round and place a bor marker between the first and last stitch of the round the bor will sit at the mid-back work the collar as follows rounds 1-12 slip bor marker *knit 1 purl 1* to the end of the round round 13 slip bor marker purl all stitches rounds 14-25 slip bor marker *knit 1 purl 1* to the end of the round in the next round you will work each live stitch together with the corresponding stitch of the cast-on edge to form a double-folded collar this can be intimidating and a bit fiddly if you are new to the technique but it gets easier when you get into the flow of it you may find it helpful to place a clip-on stitch marker every 5- 10 stitches on both the live stitches and the cast-on edge to ensure that your collar doesn t become skewed work this as follows fold the collar in half along the row of purl stitches so that the cast-on edge is sitting inside of your circular needle and the purl bumps are facing rs out *look back down the column of the next stitch on your left-hand needle and identify the cast-on stitch for that column put it on the left-hand needle and knit it together with the live stitch as you would a k2tog * repeat this process from * to * until all of the stitches have been worked with their corresponding cast-on stitch matching up the clip-on stitch markers on the live stitches and cast-on edge will help here set up the yoke sizes i-l only you will now work a series of increases in preparation for the chart to do so you will need to change to your 4 5 mm us 7 needle with a 40-cm 16-in cord these increases are worked as follows 9 size i slip
